title: 3-D User Interaction
description: This course focuses on the design of three-dimensional (3-D) user interfaces, VR devices, and interaction techniques. The course consists of lectures, student presentations, and programming assignments. Students will be expected to create VR applications to learn how VR displays and 3-D interactions work. Prerequisites: CSE 167 or CSE 167R or MATH 155A; restricted to CS25, CS26, CS27, CS29, and EC26 majors. All other students will be allowed as space permits.
